tool_description: API for fetching current, or historical, moon phase data. Get lunar phase name, emoji, lunar age, lunar distance, and more.
name: Historical Moon Phase API
title: Historical Moon Phase API

api_list.name: Lunar Age
api_list.description: Provides lunar age, lunar age percentage, and lunar distance for a given date. If no date is specified, the date is set to today.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://historical-moon-phase-api.p.rapidapi.com/moon/age"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "historical-moon-phase-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Moon Phase Emoji
api_list.description: Gets an emoji of a moon phase. For current, specify nothing in the request body. For a historical date, specify the date in the "date" parameter. Specify "NORTHERN" or "SOUTHERN" if you'd like to specify hemisphere (defaults to NORTHERN).
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://historical-moon-phase-api.p.rapidapi.com/moon/emoji"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "historical-moon-phase-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Moon Phase
api_list.description: Gets current or historical data for the moon phase. To specify a date, add it in the "date" parameter of the request body. If you'd like current data, simply specify nothing for the date. Specify "NORTHERN" or "SOUTHERN" for a hemisphere, default is NORTHERN.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://historical-moon-phase-api.p.rapidapi.com/moon/phase"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "historical-moon-phase-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
